Description: Black-topped red ware pottery bowl with thin walls made of very fine Nile silt. The exterior has diagonal rippling, red slip and fine burnishing perpendicular to the rippling. The interior is blackened and burnished while moist with a broad implement. White residue adheres to the interior. Rim is milled. Rounded base is not rippled, worn from use.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s (1937) Black-topped Red BR31D. From grave of an adolescent female (?); the bowl was found covered with matting and contained brown organic matter.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p.38, 50; pl. 17.31D)
Condition: good, rim chipped in places, reconstructed from fragments.
